"#222222"},"calendar":{"defaultView":null},"headerText":"","footerText":"In compliance with Titles VI & VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, the Americans with Disabilities Act and Colorado law, Steamboat Springs School District RE2 does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability or need for special education services in admissions, access to, treatment, or employment in educational programs or activities which it operates. Complaint procedures have been established for students, parents, employees and others. Compliance officers are:
Employee misconduct and ADA/EEO complaints: Director of Human Resources Katie Jacobs, 325 7th Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3197 or kjacobs@ssk12.org.
Student misconduct complaints: SSHS Assistant Principal/Activity Director Luke DeWolfe, SSHS, 45 East Maple Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3686 or ldewolfe@ssk12.org.
504 complaints: NWBOCES Executive Director, POB 773390, Steamboat Springs, CO 80477, PH: 970-879-0391

div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":8099,"message":"School Closure through the end of the school year - Message from Superintendent Brad Meeks.\r\nThe COVID-19 crisis has affected our community in ways we never could have anticipated and disrupted our lives for much longer than we ever could have imagined. Back in March, we were hopeful that school closures would be temporary. Today, the reality is that students will not return this school year.","type":"banner"}]}

a.title: Counseling Services
a.div: Click here for links to contact school counselors at each SSSD school. Counseling Google site and counselor calendars (to schedule an appointment) are available. Email information and office hours for your school counselor are listed on the counseling department’s google website.

a.title: Mental Health
a.div: Click here for mental health resources and supports.

img.div: Steamboat Springs schools are closed for in-person learning for 2019-20.

a.title: Schools Closed
a.div:
On April 21, 2020 Governor Jared Polis communicated that schools are not coming back in-person this school year. We are committed to continuing remote learning for students through the last day of the 2019-20 school year (June 2).
Click here to read our announcement.

img.div: Free “brown bag” lunch and breakfast. starting Wednesday March 18th and will continue, excluding Saturdays and Sundays, until further notice. All students are welcome to participate. Please look for a school district white bus. Distribution sites updated April 3, 2020.

img.div: We will do our best to troubleshoot technology issues over the phone.

li.div:
We are not able to come to homes. We will do our best to contact you and troubleshoot over the phone.
When you email us, please share your contact info and best times to reach you. Please include your students name and his/her teachers name in your request.
SPE - email support.spe@ssk12.org
SCE - email support.sce@ssk12.org
SSMS - email support.ssms@ssk12.org
SSHS - email support.sshs@ssk12.org
YVHS - email support.yvhs@ssk12.org
For help in Spanish please call 970-734-8002

div.div: Our mission is to provide a caring, connected, and stable environment defined by high expectations, individual progression, and great teaching via distance learning to help all Steamboat Springs School District students continue their education and work toward their academic potential and life goals while schools are closed.

div.div: The Routt County Coronavirus / COVID-19 Help Line can be reached at 970-871-8444 from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. seven days per week. The Help Line cannot provide referrals for testing. If you are having a medical emergency please call 911.

Phone number for Steamboat Springs School District Re-2

span.data-emptytext: Steamboat Springs School District Re-2 provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: In compliance with Titles VI & VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, the Americans with Disabilities Act and Colorado law, Steamboat Springs School District RE2 does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability or need for special education services in admissions, access to, treatment, or employment in educational programs or activities which it operates. Complaint procedures have been established for students, parents, employees and others. Compliance officers are: Employee misconduct and ADA/EEO complaints: Director of Human Resources Katie Jacobs, 325 7th Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3197 or kjacobs@ssk12.org. Student misconduct complaints: SSHS Assistant Principal/Activity Director Luke DeWolfe, SSHS, 45 East Maple Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3686 or ldewolfe@ssk12.org. 504 complaints: NWBOCES Executive Director, POB 773390, Steamboat Springs, CO 80477, PH: 970-879-0391

p.span: In compliance with Titles VI & VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, the Americans with Disabilities Act and Colorado law, Steamboat Springs School District RE2 does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability or need for special education services in admissions, access to, treatment, or employment in educational programs or activities which it operates. Complaint procedures have been established for students, parents, employees and others. Compliance officers are: Employee misconduct and ADA/EEO complaints: Director of Human Resources Katie Jacobs, 325 7th Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3197 or kjacobs@ssk12.org. Student misconduct complaints: SSHS Assistant Principal/Activity Director Luke DeWolfe, SSHS, 45 East Maple Street, Steamboat Springs, CO 80487, PH: 970-871-3686 or ldewolfe@ssk12.org. 504 complaints: NWBOCES Executive Director, POB 773390, Steamboat Springs, CO 80477, PH: 970-879-0391

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
